results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada”.
The soil of the foothills of the Rocky Mountains (North America) is ideal for pasture, and the climate is excellently suited to cattle-raising. Modern methods of protecting cattle during winter, how they are treated for warble-fly, methods of breeding, spring migration to fresh grazing lands, mustering for market, and shipping away for sale, are studied on this film of Canadian cattle raising. No credits available.

results.title: Cattle country
results.brief_description: This film provides information on the beef cattle industry in Australia. It presents a general picture of beef cattle types, including the major British breeds, some tropical breeds, and the European exotics, now making their appearance in the country. Intended in particular for students and young farmers. No further credits available.

results.title: Cattle and the corn belt
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
The Middle West States of America play an important part in producing the country’s meat supply. Here are the cattle buyers and the packing plants, but the cattle business begins in Montana and Wyoming on the cattle ranches. The film shows the annual roundup, the branding, and the shipments of cattle in the fall to the farmers in the corn belt, where they are fattened for market.

results.title: Cats and dogs
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gurian and Jack Sholder
results.brief_description: The relationship between a man and woman is explored in a series of episodes which reveal much about them and about their attitude to each other. There is both comedy and futility in their arguments - she is concerned with understanding and developing a deeper relationship while he is impatient with her intellectualizing of the situation.

results.title: Catheterizing the male patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
A United States Navy training film featuring instructive animations demonstrating male genitourinary function. Describes various ways of assisting the male bed patient to pass water when difficulty in doing so occurs. The last resort, catheterising, is illustrated in detail.

results.title: Cathedral city
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Don Chaffey
results.brief_description: A celluloid pilgramage to the seat of the Anglican Church, the Church of Christ Cathedral in Canterbury. After a solemn survey of noteworthy cathedral features, the film explores the larger city in relation to the dominant architectural edifice.

results.title: Caterpillar
results.brief_description: An animated story about a little boy and a small, green caterpillar that dances to the catchy tune the little boy plays on his mouth organ. Discovered by an entrepreneur, they soon become big business until the caterpillar seemingly disappears.

results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.
results.creator_credit_for_label: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College

results.creator_credit: Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture. Longerenong Campus
